meanings.definition: A loud, disturbing noise or clamor.
meanings.sent1: The children's racketing in the playground could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The racketing of the construction work next door kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent3: The racketing of pots and pans in the kitchen signaled that dinner was almost ready.
meanings.sent4: The racketing of the thunderstorm outside made the windows shake.
meanings.sent5: The racketing of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly in the morning.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, disturbing noise.
meanings.sent1: The wind racketing through the trees sounded like a ghostly whisper.
meanings.sent2: The kids racketing with their toys in the living room were having a great time.
meanings.sent3: The old car engine started racketing loudly after sitting unused for years.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks racketing in the sky painted a beautiful display of colors.
meanings.sent5: The drums racketing in the distance signaled the start of the parade.

meanings.definition: A fraudulent scheme or illegal activity.
meanings.sent1: The authorities uncovered a complex racketing involving multiple businesses.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist was arrested for his involvement in a racketing operation.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie portrayed a hilarious racketing gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: The novel's plot twist revealed a shocking racketing at the heart of the story.
meanings.sent5: The news report exposed a nationwide racketing that had deceived many people.

meanings.definition: To engage in fraudulent schemes or illegal activities.
meanings.sent1: The criminals were racketing behind the scenes, planning their next move.
meanings.sent2: The group of hackers was caught racketing into sensitive government databases.

meanings.sent4: The corrupt officials were racketing public funds for their personal gain.
